Landing.title: FrontEndCademy - Learn FrontEnd development
Landing.description: Want to learn FrontEnd? We've got free tutorials and a community of developers to help you improve your skills.

LandingHero.description: Learn FrontEnd development, <0>with help from the open-source community.</0>

LandingHtml.headline: If you want to learn <0>FrontEnd</0> from scratch <1/> Start with the  <2> HTML Module </2>
LandingHtml.description: It's specially made for beginners, and you'll learn to write and understand code like the one below

LandingChristmasAdvent.title: Learn 3D programming with Three.js and React!
LandingChristmasAdvent.description: Together with <0>Colorful Coding</0> we created an interactive tutorial in which you help <1> Santa Claus </1> repair the gift factory.
LandingChristmasAdvent.loadingError: We couldn't load the example. Try reloading the page.

LandingTidbits.title: And if you're already a <0>programmer</0>, <1/> Each week we post <2>Tips & Tricks</2>

LandingResources.title: Oh, almost forgot! We have a <0>list of resources</0> to help you in your FrontEnd development career

LandingSubscribe.title: Stay connected to what happens next
LandingSubscribe.description: If we haven't convinced you to start a tutorial yet, but you'd like us to keep you updated with future tutorials (no spam, we promise) - leave your email here and join the community.

HtmlLanding.description: with an online course, focused on <0>practice and feedback</0> from experienced developers
HtmlLanding.htmlDescription: Is the starting point of every <0>FrontEnd developer's</0> journey.
HtmlLanding.frontendLanguages: Together with <0> CSS </0> and <1> JavaScript </1> it is one of the 3 languages you have to learn to build websites and web applications.
HtmlLanding.whatWillYouLearnDescription: This course is created for people with zero (or very little) FrontEnd experience, so we'll start with the basics and then continue with lots of practice.

whatYouWillLearn.2: What is the role of HTML in FrontEnd development?
whatYouWillLearn.3: How to use <0>VSCode</0> as a code editor
whatYouWillLearn.4: What are most important HTML elements and how to use them?
whatYouWillLearn.5: Best practices in the area of code writing, accessibility and performance

certification.title: At the end you'll be awarded a certification!
certification.description: In programming, it's not so much the degrees themselves, but what your technical skills are. So use this certification as proof that you've written real, production-ready code validated by experienced developers!

HtmlCssJs.cssDescription: Add colors, spacing, fonts, etc. It makes the page beautiful and easy to use.
HtmlCssJs.jsDescription: Add functionality: you can create tasks and then mark them as completed.

CheckboxOnboarding.description: Click the checkboxes to see what the component below looks like without CSS or JavaScript.

content.1: Each concept is explained through a text lesson, with code examples.
At the end of each lesson you will find one or more exercises, which you must <0> solve </0> and then send to us for <1>feedback</1>.
We look at each solved exercise to see if it is correct and follows good programming practices.
If the exercise is not correct, we send you improvement feedback directly in the platform.
Based on the feedback received you will modify the solution, and then submit it once more for evaluation.
We are looking over this new solution again, to confirm if your changes are correct.

Diploma.description:exercises: has successfully finished the <0>{{TUTORIAL}}</0> successfully solving all {{COUNT}} exercises.
